Here is a list of concrete visual elements that the final image must contain to depict a step-by-step illustration of how to throw pottery on a wheel:

*   Pottery wheel head
*   Lump of clay (initial state on the wheel head)
*   Hands actively centering the clay
*   A centered cone or dome of clay on the wheel head
*   Hands creating an opening in the centered clay
*   Clay form with a distinct central opening on the wheel head
*   Hands pulling up the clay walls
*   Clay form with raised, cylindrical or conical walls on the wheel head
*   Hands shaping the clay walls into a vessel
*   A recognizable pottery vessel (e.g., bowl, vase, cylinder) formed on the wheel head
